Reviews.Title: “Superb family stay”
Reviews.Author: GalwayWalshfamily
Reviews.Content: We visited for three days at the end of Easter week. We are a family of four, with two sons aged 12 and 14. We found the apartments on tripadvisor and decided to trust the reviews. We were thrilled with that decision. We were incredibly impressed with all the staff. The reception staff were the most helpful we have ever come across with brilliant multilingual skills.They could not do enough to help and advise us and nothing was too much trouble. The cleaning staff were delightful. Whoever owns/runs the business should be so proud of the staff and the atmosphere they create. In terms of location if was superb. We have been to Barcelona many times but decided to take the bus tour on the first day to show the boys. We got great advice on which route to follow as there is a choice by the staff. We were very tired 2 nights and asked staff to suggest places to eat. Again, great suggestions of two tapas places nearby. We cannot recall the names, but super and the only places the staff suggested. We went somewhere further afield the other evening. We did not eat in the hotel but the menu looked good. There is a very large excellent supermarket about 2 minutes walk away or less and a lovely bakery the same distance in the opposite direction. It was tempting to cook from the incredible fish counter but we didn't. The apartment was lovely and ample size for four of us. We had a view (sort of) from the top floor but we would have been just as happy at the back of the building. We were not woken by noise. Lovely sheets and towels, slightly poor water pressure. In summary, have no hesitation, in terms of location and value (especially for families) unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location offering a first rate comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nilas5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hispanos 7 Suiza in April 2012. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment which was very comfortable for our family of 5. It was great having an apartment with a kitchen which allowed us the flexibility to eat in when needed. The location wasperfect, right next to the Sagrada Familia. The apartment was close to the metro as well. The reception staff were very helpful. It was great having a balcony overlooking the Sagrada Familia. The best feature was having a housekeeping service so one could have the benefit of staying in an apartment while at the same time getting the perks of a hotel stay. One of the guide books that we had read said that breakfast was complimentary but that was not the case, it was 5 Euros per person. However, there was great bakery closeby where one could pick up breakfast. In addition, there were several grocery stores nearby to buy supplies as needed. Will highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “5 star? No, but the location is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: AnastaciaVC
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel/apartments from the high rating it got from TripAdvisor. Reception staff were great: helpful, efficient, spoke English well. It is a nonsmoking facility. The location can't be beat because right out of the hotel turn right and at the end of the block on the left is Sagrada Familia cathedral and it's subway station. Unfortunately that's the best bits. At 295 EUR per night it wasn't a good value. Read the rest of this post and see why Beds were very hard and none of us slept very well. I also developed a rash on my face and my physician back home thought it might have been caused by something on the towels or linens. It might have been from the bleach since there was a noticeable "bleach" smell. Never had that happen before. Noise from the halls and other rooms was VERY pronounced. We had room 501 which has a door that connects to the next room/suite. Let's just say I could hear the man next door with the smokers cough through 2 closed doors. He also liked watching tv at 03:00 in the morning. Every time another guest(s) would leave their room you can hear every footstep on the wood floors and all of the conversation. If you order the breakfast the "savory" breakfast is a packaged ham and cheese sandwich, a bottle of juice, fresh fruit salad and Nespresso. Not a bad price at 5 EUR per person but definitely not 5 star. The Nespresso machine in the room is a little tricky to use but worth the effort. Our room had only one bathroom with one sink. With four people in room/suite it really needs at least two sinks. My suggestion is for management to redo the bathroom with two sinks and remove the bidet. Maintenance of the unit could be improved too. The baseboard along the main part of the little kitchen and squashed toes, twice. One chair's cushion didn't have support and one of our guests sunk into it. That chair was also poorly upholstered and could see the foam pad.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: AmericanExpat92
Reviews.Content: We just visited Barcelona for Spring Break. We stayed at "7 Suiza" and it was the perfect choice for our family. We have 2 daughters, 9 & 12 years old. We stayed in a two bedroom apartment and from our balcony, we had a view of the Sagrada Familia. The apartment had a proper kitchen, dining table and sitting room with TV. The apartment came with 2 spacious bathrooms and the 2 bedrooms were comfortable. The apartment gave our family the space and comfort we often struggle to find for an affordable price when traveling. While the location is more residential than "touristy, we enjoyed the neighborhood. We discovered great markets, bakeries, butchers and restaurants. The metro is right next to the hotel so we easily traveled all around the city. If you are looking for an affordable, comfortable, easy stay in Barcelona, I highly recommend 7 Suiza.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But Praise”
Reviews.Author: moeline
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully comfortable for our family of five, with great supermarkets close by, and strolling distance to the Sagrada Familia /metro. We stayed five nights but would have loved a little longer. The staff were, without exception, helpful and engaging and competent English speakers. Although the room with a view we had requested was not available when we arrived (a good two hours earlier than the 2pm check in) they quickly sorted out another one. I was confined to the room for three days with a little parting gift from an Andalucian restaurant, and I must say I was feeling delicate about hygiene. I am pleased to report that the cleaners who came each day were thorough - lots of cleaning cloths- efficient and professional in every way. On our last night I joined my family at the atmospheric 'La Cupula' restaurant for the best - but not most expensive - meal we ate in Spain. Don't miss it. Next morning, we took a taxi-van ordered through the front desk to the airport; the taxi driver charged us 65 euro instead of the agreed 55. We paid him but were cross, so we took a photo of the driver and emailed it to the hotel so that they could avoid this happening to other guests. Much to our astonishment, the hotel arranged for the driver to reimburse us the difference, plus 5 euro for the inconvenience - and then for it to be donated to the Sagrada Familia at our request! An exceptional effort from an exceptional team.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Matias82
Reviews.Content: Besides what I already wrote in the title, having a kitchen in Barcelona was awesome. I strongly suggest to go to a Mercat, ask at any of the stands for what is good today, and cook it yourself. Just like the locals do.

Reviews.Title: “Great family break”
Reviews.Author: jonnyjabbah
Reviews.Content: This was an October half term break with the family for three nights. What a find! This apartment hotel was superb, from the price to location. We looked out over the Sagrada familia cathedral and saw it from our balcony. Great to have a dishwasher and washing machine if needed. Breakfast walk two minutes around the corner to a bakery and croissants etc much cheaper than the hotel breakfast but they don't mind you bringing it in. Ate in restaurant one night very good value but next night they recommended a tapas place around the corner and was lovely. Staff delightful and always a help. This is a superb find.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Noe A
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience of staying in an apartment as we usually book hotels. We were deligted with every aspect of our accommodation, from the facilities provided to the staff who were attentive and could not do enough to help us enjoy our experience, the focus on customer care was exceptional. The location was perfect and close to the metro and the La Sagrada Familia, we were given the option to have a balcony view which was a bonus. We will definitely consider apartment accommodation for future trips and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family stay”
Reviews.Author: chelsea91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom apartment at this hotel for 10 days. It was perfect. Beautifully decorated apartment with everything we needed. Had a kitchen and laundry, 2 bathrooms with additional toilet, lounge, dining room and a huge balcony. All with daily cleaning. The hotel is just around the corner from the Sagrada Familia with a great choice of places to eat, a grocer nice and close and the metro close by as well. Barcelona is also a fantastic place to walk and sightsee and we found the walk to La Ramblas a great way to see the city with La Pedrera and Casa Batlio on the way. Absolutely love Barcelona and can't wait to go back and stay at Hispanos and do more exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well equipped apartment (junior suite) located near Familia Sagrada”
Reviews.Author: DLF_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of a two week trip. We were extremely pleased with the junior suite which felt like a full apartment rather than a hotel room. It had a very well equipped kitchen, living room and two large bedrooms. The location made it easy to travel anywhere by metro. The surrounding area has many resteraunts, shops and groceries

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: pzampini
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 8 nights in late November, and we love this apartment/hotel. Friendly staff, clean and well maintained rooms, secure, close to metro and to the deservedly famous Sagrada Familia, great grocery market just around the corner, cafes and good restaurants short walks away, and a very fine restaurant (La Cupula) attached to the hotel. Minor complaints: our room overlooked a busy street and traffic noise lasted well into the night. The windows are pretty thick and good at shutting out most of the noise, and we slept well overall. Ask for a room on a higher floor so you have a view from the cute balcony. The kitchen could use more cooking equipment, so if you plan to cook in a lot bring along a good knife and frying pan. Otherwise, the kitchen was adequate. The washer/dryer was weak by US standards, but serviceable. Dishwasher OK. Take along some detergents, a sponge, paper towels, salt/pepper, sugar, tea bags, if you can fit it in. The coffee maker is a Delonghi pod espresso type, so ground coffee is useless. Buy pods. More positives: we ate twice at La Cupula and loved it both times. My teenage sons still talk about the meals we had there. It's a bit pricey, but it is a Michelin rated place and the hotel gives you a 10% discount. They also have a fixed price menu that changes daily for a reasonable 13 or 14 euro (19 dollars), and the wine list is very reasonably priced. The paella we had at La Cupula was by far the best version of several we tried that week. We would definitely stay there again. And don't let all the chatter about thieves and pickpockets deter you from visiting this fabulous city. Just use common sense. Lock your passports and other valuables in the room safe, hide your money and credit card inside a zippered pocket, avoid La Rambla at night, and enjoy! We never felt unsafe all week. The people were the friendliest of any city in my experience. No one gave us "attitude", even with our very limited ability to speak the language. At our last meal (Maitea Taberna) the server presented us with the bill and a complementary bottle of Rioja! When has that happened to you in the U.S.?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: travellinmama6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this apartment with our 16 month old and it was perfect. 2 bedrooms, a cot, a living room, kitchen - the works. Plus, they arranged a babysitter for us and transport to and from the airport with a baby-seat. Extremely friendly, and courteous. Location is close to Sangrada Familia, so not close to old town Barcelona - but it is nice and quiet and close to a metro. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and cosy rooms, excellent restaurant”
Reviews.Author: RaimondasM
Reviews.Content: very cosy, clean rooms; 24-hours reception desk that is very good for late arrivals like in our case; central location; very very good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Sobe21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days with a friend. We had the two bedroom apartment and it was very spacious, and with 2 bathrooms also made it very easy to share the space. + great room with view of La Sagrada Familia + easy walk past a park to a metro stop and then easy access to rest of Barcelona + kitchenette with washer/dryer (though ours didn't work well) + friendly staff - didn't like the included breakfast at all, even though it was free I skipped it after the first day

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and very close to Sagrada Famila”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: Shared a 2 bedroom apt with a single friend. Very comfortable rooms with 2 bathrooms - perfect. Nice size kitchen, dining and lounge area (We had a view of the top of Sagrada!!! - it was incredible to see anytime we were out on the balcony). Used the coffee machine and the washing machine - both clean and easy to use. Hotel reception staff very friendly and helpful. Apartment is close to several supermarkets, the metro and of course - Sagrada. We stayed in another apartment in Barceloneta a few weeks after this stay and didn't enjoy being in that area and the apartment was small and dirty so wished we had rebooked this place. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apart-hotel - quiet, spacious and ideal for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: callmedave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2011 and were delighted to find a full-sized apartment with 2 proper bedrooms, a bathroom and separate living / dining / kitchen area. All nicely done.....comfy beds, shutters for security and a well equipped kitchen area. We deliberately chose away from the Ramblas / old city area to get somewhere more quiet, and it worked very well. Metro stop was 5 minutes away and the Barcelona metro system was fabulous - new, air conditioned trains and they show you how long, to the second, the next train will be.....really easy to get around. A special note re Albert, one of the reception people at Hispanos 7 Suiza. He was marvellous - couldn't have been more helpful and was so accommodating in helping me to check in on-line for return flights.....a very nice man indeed. Would thoroughly recommend - an apartment for the cost of a decent standard hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Fabulash
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Sep. 24 - 27 for 3 nights prior to boarding the Star Princess for a 13 day Grand Mediterranean cruise. My husband & I shared a 2-bedroom, 2 bathroom apt. with my sister and hubby. Our apt. was on the 2nd floor and included a living room, dining area, small kitchen (with a combination clothes washer/dryer in it) and balcony. The apt. was very nicely furnished, modern and comfortable. The location was very good as it was just around the corner a couple of blocks from the famous Sagrada Familia Cathederal and close to public transportation and the hop-on-hop-off tourist bus line. We decided to pre-order the hotel's continental breakfast plan. You decide what you want the day before and at 8:00 am they arrive with everything you need for your coffee or tea and choices of sandwiches, croissants, & cereals. Note: Regarding the coffee, it comes in these little packs that fit into the coffee machine. We were expecting a coffee carafe, however the ladies that delivered our breakfast showed us how to use the machine. The people at this property were very nice and helpful. There is also a small grocery store right across the street where we purchased cheeses, wine & crackers. And....there is a very nice restaurant on the hotel property, unfortunately we did not get a chance to use it. Note: We were glad that we printed off the Google map for this apt. hotel as our Taxi driver did not know where it was and the map was very helpful. It's tucked away on a small side street. My sister and husband arrived on a later flight and used a pre-arranged transfer service which ended up being a very tiring "milk-run" as the bus had many other people to drop off at various hotels. We were very glad we just grabbed a taxi that took us directly to our hotel. The taxi was metered and a reasonable price. I don't think my sister saved any money doing it the other way. We absolutely loved Barcelona - what a fabulous, fascinating and beautiful city. We would love to go back and stay for much longer!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lisah101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise and it was wonderful. There was some concern with we fist checked in. I had requested a room in the front of the hotel and they gave us a second floor room at the rear with no view. Ok, I can survive, so we went to the room and 5 minutes later the front desk called asking if our room was OK. Honestly I was trying to use the internet to find another hotel because the construction on the other side of the wall was deafening. I could barely hear the girl on the phone. I had gone down to the desk once to ask about the construction and she said she didn't know how long it would last so I am grateful they called to check on us because we were researching other hotels even though this place was prepaid for 3 days (the noise was that bad). Mom's bathroom had an odd window in the shower that opened up to some sort of storage/access room where the men were working!!!! The immediately moved us to a higher floor room in the front of the hotel. It was amazing and we stopped looking for another place. Although it was annoying, they were very proactive in realizing the problem and moving us to another room. BTW.. the coffee maker in the kitchen takes Pods, we went to the grocery to buy some. We also loved having a washing machine although it took some time to figure out.... even with the directions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good tip for visiting Barcelona !”
Reviews.Author: ThorTheHague-Paris
Reviews.Content: We found this appart' hotel by chance, browsing tripadvisor site (Thank you for this excellent tip..) As mentioned before, spacious rooms, small balcony, good airco, very good and friendly service. 5mns walk from Sagrada Familia, quiet area, 5mns walk from the modern metro which will take you anywhere in Barcelona within minutes. We bought card for 10 trips, used only 8 in 3 days. One tip: near the ramblas, there is a covered market where you can eat...try this at lunch time, very good experience fresh fish, good wines.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: elnoj
Reviews.Content: Barrhead staff answered some queries which I had about transfers in Barcelona and helped with some pre-travel questions which I had difficulty entering onto the system. All politely and speedily dealt with. My wife and I travelled from Edinburgh airport on Ryanair to Barcelona and although having some misgivings about this operator in fact it was on time taking off and landing in both directions. Onboard food and drink was too expensive but we knew that beforehand. Taking just one checked bag kept the cost down and was all we needed. The room was in fact an apartment and I don't think we appreciated that fully before we went but it was a two-bedroomed flat within the Hispano 7 Suiza hotel - very well appointed and comfortable, everything working including aircon, and a modern fully-equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine. The dishwasher was straightforward enough. Although we didn't use the washing machine, a previous comment about no instructions still stands, but I'm sure we could have had it explained. The bathroom was modern and clean. The lounge came complete with 3-piece suite and a 40" colour TV. So apart from the TV programme languages - mainly Spanish and Catalan a bit of home from home. We ordered breakfast as room service twice, which was supplied promptly and was good value. The hotel has a permanent display of well-restored old Hispano Suiza cars (hence the name) - a bit bizarre perhaps but we did have a look! Reception service was always prompt helpful and courteous. Internet access via a PC was available free - only had one problem with access but the network was was being maintained at the time. A 100 metre walk took us to the nearest internet cafe at €1 per hour, so no great problem. Location was in the Eixample district which is a bit out of the centre but close to the Sagrada Familia cathedral designed by Gaudi so this was a convenient first day choice of venue. Despite being slightly out of the centre the Old City and beach and other attractions were easily accessed by either the Tourist Bus (which did on the second day) or by T-10 ticket on the very clean and efficient underground system. The T-10 allowed 10 separate trips and 2 of these cost us around €17 which for a week's transport was excellent. There is so much to see and do in Barcelona that we could only cover the main attractions such as Gaudi's Casa Bottli, Picasso Museum, Museu de la Reia (municipal museum with a wealth of artefacts and excavated Roman streets), La Rambla to mention a few. Only one attempt at pickpocketting on a crowded underground but I recognised the MO - woman distraction while her accomplice was busy trying to open my haversack, foiled when I suddenly pulled it round and he ended up on the floor! But let that be a warning to the unwary - and wear a money belt discreetly hidden as this is sport that's well known in crowded places in Barcelona. Best - Sagrada Familia - absolutely amazing Worst - attempted theft!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: smithfamilyhols
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hispanos 7 Suiza apartment hotel, and again we were extremely happy with our stay. Parking is easy, underneath the hotel. The location is great; a few minutes from the Sagrada Famillia and the hotel receptionists were happy and helpful. Sometimes, surprisingly quite rare! We love the layout of the apartment - two comfortable bedrooms, two modern bathrooms and a lounge/kitchen area. A perfect base. Don't expect English TV or a particularly well equipped kitchen - but when Barcelona is on your doorstep, why would you need either!?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: tonyduffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a two bedroom suite prior to a cruise on Disney Magic. It was perfect in every way, close to the metro, shops and sights - even a Starbucks within walking distance. The apartment was well equipt, very clean and comforable and the staff were always helpful and friendly and spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation with family near Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: Samuelpas
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to Sagrada Familia where I also found the tourist interest points : subway station, many restaurants, souvenirs shop, the city tour bus stop, money changer. The facilities of the room also very good and complete. I feel at home. I can wash and dry our clothes and cook. The daily menu for breakfast and dinner are also cheap enough but without loosing its delicious taste. The housekeeper can't speak English at all, but she really tried hardly to help us. Even, after the housekeeper gone in the afternoon, the front office staff still like to help us when we need someting for our room. All front office staffs are fluently in English. I stay here with my family for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ann K
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a suite over the Easter holiday. The apartment was light, airy, spacious and well equipped and within easy reach of the Sacrada Familia, buses, metro and lots of restaurants. We probably wouldn't bother to order the breakfast again, as there is a large supermarket just round the corner and a bread shop which provides better value. It would be nice if hotel advised on how to get to and from the airport by public transport (easily achieved) as the taxis are exorbitant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, spacious apartments.”
Reviews.Author: Ernierich
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at the Apartments 7 suiza. We still can't believe how big the apartment was for the four of us. We really didn't need two bathrooms! The apartments are very well equipped and have a washing machine and dishwasher - very handy for the babies bottles. We had a really large balcony which faced other houses but was a nice little sun-trap and gave us the opportunity to people watch (I won't mention the naked couple) The reception staff were so helpful and although the apartments aren't right in the middle of things (although they are a stones throw from Sagrada Familia) getting around was incredibly easy with a bus and metro stop practically on top of the building. I would definately stay here again and would recommend the apartments to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We would highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: nickychichester
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband, son and his partner. Booked after reading reviews. As we booked through tripadvisor we were entitled to a free 3 course meal which we had on the first evening.We had a lovely evening. The restaurant was really nice, very unusually with a couple of vintage cars! the service and food was very good. We were very pleased with the apartment. Very clean and well equiped. Although there were only two chairs on the balcony, it would have been nice to have four chairs. The staff were all very friendly and very helpful. The location was perfect, just around the corner from the Sagrada Familia and metro. We would be very happy to return to the Hispanos 7 Suiza.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: OldLanghoTraveller
Reviews.Content: Chose to stay here based on previous reviews. On the first floor, street side and was quite noisy - bins seemed to be emptied hourly! Had a two bedroom apartment with extra bed in the lounge. Extra bed is very restricting on movement around the small lounge, dining area so be aware. Overall clean and well equiped. Nice to have the ability to eat in if desired. Ate in the attached restaurant once. Very good food but not cheap (most expensive meal in Barca we had). Also quite quiet - ate upstairs so looking in from the street looked empty so not encouraging. Overall would seriously consider if back in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Thumper51
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights in Hispanos 7 Suiza and it was perfect for family of 2 adults & 3 children 13,11 & 8. It is very hard to find hotels with interconnecting rooms and none would take 5 so this was a great find - 2 bedrooms- 1 double & 1 twin with extra roll away bed for the youngest and 2 bathrooms. Our room 303 had a wonderful view of Sagrada Famillia from the balcony - great to sit out in the evening with a glass of wine and watch the world go by! The apartment was very clean & comfortable and had everything we needed. We didn't hear anything from other apartments and only minimal street noise - to be expected in any city. Wifi and TV were fine - kids mainly watched the FC Barcelona dedicated TV channel - didn't matter that it was in spanish - just showed endless football! Location was fantastic with Sagrada Famillia and metro just around the corner- 10 trip metro tickets are great value. It was very easy to navigate the metro and we could easlly get all around the city from here. Taxis generally only take 4 unless you find a rare larger taxi so metro was much better. 24 hr supermarket with wonderful deli opposite is just a block away. We didn't bother with breakfast from the hotel, just got supplies and catered ourselves. We ate one night in the restaurant - great value Menu Del Dia - 3 courses & coffee for only €16 or €20 wth glass of wine. Staff at reception were very helpful and friendly - held our bags for the day after we checked out & booked a taxi for us to the airport on the last day. I woul definitely recommend these apartments for families or groups who want hotel standard accomodation with the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Seasites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hispanos 7 Suiza for five nights in mid May 2011. Suite 401 was great accommodation for two couples, compete with air conditioning and wi-fi. The suite consisted of two double rooms, two baths, kitchen, lounge area, and a terrace. At no time did we find the suite noisy with the windows closed and always plenty of hot water. The kitchen was equipped with utensils, pots and pans, plates, glassware, etc. The clothes washer was really appreciated as we could hang clothes on the line dryer on the terrace. The supermarket just around the corner was a convenient shopping stop enabling us to have breakfasts and snacks in the suite. The staff were very helpful in providing information about where to eat, sights to see, etc. They even helped us find accommodatino for an additional night's stay in Barcelona when we decided to extend our stay (unfortunately for us, Hispanos was fully booked). The cleaning staff kept the suite extremely clean and even helped us figure out how to work the washer the first time. Although locatet very close to Sagrada Familia, the street is very quiet. Our suite faced a courtyard; very quiet although from time to time school children playing outside added a touch of liveliness. The only downside may be that Hispanos is located some distance from the sights (except Sagrada Familia), but we walked just about everywhere so did not find this to be a problem at all. There is a metro stop close by for those who prefer not to walk and taxis are very reasonable and plentiful. Note: if taking the metro as well as in other crowded, touristy locations be very, very, alert to pickpocketers and be sure to read the Trip Advisor section on scams in Barcelona. We always felt it was an achievement to get through the day without losing belongings.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for families”
Reviews.Author: MariauBeijing
Reviews.Content: five minutes away from the temple of la Sagrada Familia, classic but tasteful decoration apartments. i kinda felt like at home! staff very helpful, giving directions and recommending places to go, we really appreciated that

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this Hotel... Awful......RIP OFF!!!”
Reviews.Author: gendent
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through AGODA (also Rubbish, do not use). I won't bore you with the details but this hotel is bad value. It was so noisy between room that the man in the next door suite ( I use this term liberally liberally) blew his nose and I thought he was in the bed next to me!. They have an ill informed reception that really enjoyed winding us up. Breakfast was very poor and you would be better off ging to the supermarket and buying the items yourself!. And to top it all off at the end after offering to refund our last nights stay, they are now clawing back the money in extra payments. They offered us free parking and breakfast which they now want us to pay for... SO no Refund, although I have tried to contact them on a number of occasions., They also wanted more money for the children...Although I had said quite clearly on the booking that I had 2 they seemed unaware of this fact and wanted to charge me an extra 30 euro a day per child! If you like staying in a Elephant and Castle council flat then this is the hotel for you! An entire apartment squeezed into a normal sized hotel room. We left and Stayed at Hotel Niro in the barrio gothic... Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for family holidays in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Justpassingthrough38
Reviews.Content: Delighted with this apart/hotel right beside Sagrada Familia (note - make the most of this and get there for opening time and avoid the queues!). Fantastic location, but even better are the spacious apartments and friendly staff. Two bedrooms/two bathrooms and lounge with kitchen area. The flexibility of having your own kitchen was greatly appreciated by all (travelling with two teenage children!). Supermarket round the corner sells everything you need. Our rate included breakfast, which was slightly disappointing in terms of "quantity" and needed to be supplemented. Would recommend room only rate. The menu dia for evening meal 16euro recommended. Would love to return to Barcelona and would definitely rebook this accommodation, Noise not a problem - we had a room facing courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location yet quiet enough for good sleep”
Reviews.Author: spec80
Reviews.Content: Sagrada Familia was a short walk away but the hotel is far enough that streets aren't crowded and we got many good night's rest after packed days of sightseeing. The staff is friendly and helpful. There was a slight hiccup when we checked out but a member of the staff called us back on one of our cell phones and rectified the matter which we were really pleased with. The rooms were comfortable and clean. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it was worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: grin02us
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed staying in this hotel. the location was excellent, the rooms were comfortable for trip with kids, the kitchen was very helpful. but the main thing is the service. we wanted to thank to the reseption staff and ecpecially to Albert, who was really kind and helped us a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler12345
Reviews.Content: Positive - The apartments are perfect for friends or family. We were very happy with our stay. It's true that you can hear street noise from the rooms, however the noise tended to quiet down around midnight. Also, they provide a system where you can play music in your bedroom. I think that is a nice touch. The bathrooms were very nice for Europe. Also, liked the idea of having a kitchen. Although, we were not there long enough to use it. The location is excellent, just around the corner from Gaudi's familia sagrada. It's very easy to catch the hop on/hop off bus from there. The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful. A few critical points - The floor was a little dusty and needed a good sweep/cleaning. The furniture is starting to get a little "tired" in the sitting room. The beds were a little too firm for my liking. None of these things would prevent me from staying here again. I would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous spacious well equipped apartment with great view”
Reviews.Author: kjk153
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroomed suite for 2 adults and 2 children (9 and 11) via Booking.com in advance at great rates. We had 5th floor suite with a great view of Sagrada Familia from the balcony. The apartment was even better than I expected, and was cleaned every day. Well equipped kitchen with washing maching and dishwasher which we didn't use, but full cooker, microwave and toaster which we did use. We were even provided with washing up liquid and d/w tablets and washing tablets. There was a large supermarket conveniently around the corner open until late which was handy as we had a couple of meals in as we were tired after sightseeing. We also found a little baker nearby (turn left out apartment then 1st right) with fantastic pastries, croissants etc which we took with us for picnics. There was some noise from traffic early morning as you would expect in a city but we didn't find it a problem. Very handy for the metro L2 and L5 - we bought a couple of carnets to use between us, around 8.50 for 10 tickets. Also handy for the Bus Turistic blue route (we bought a 2 day ticket for 27 euros online). The location meant easy access in the morning to Sagrada Familia without the long queues. There was a large screen TV with lots of Spanish channels but unfortunately none in English which was a pity however the boys seemed to enjoy watching the Disney channel in Spanish! The apartment was easily big enough for 4 adults. The early check in and late check out were good (both 1200), and we were able to leave our luggage until the evening. The Taxi to the hotel from the airport was 33 euros for 4 including luggage, although on the way back we caught the metro to Passeig de Gracia and caught the Autobus to the Airport which took under 1 hour end to end.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable with extra space”
Reviews.Author: JannieAnn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights pre-cruise and needed the extra bedroom for teenage daughter. She was delighted with her own ensuite as well. Both bathrooms had great showers. The beds were also very comfy. Also chosen for close proximity to Sagrada Familia. Great area (even the taxi driver said so!) living amongst the locals. A little away from other tourist sites but close to metro and HOHO stop and a short taxi drive to Parc Guell. We didn't mind walking and hoofed it to Gaudi's La Pedrera and Casa Battlo - even in the rain! Supermarket and fruit/veg shops close by. Staff very helpful. We loved it and would love to return! We had no problem with noise level.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartments, nice place, great value (bit noisy).”
Reviews.Author: Carrie79_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 7 month old baby son. We wanted some kitchen facilities to make travelling with a baby easier hence why we went for these and we weren't disappointed. The apartments were a good size and had everything we needed. We didn't require the second bedroom but it was a nice to be able to put all of our luggage in there to store and a second bathroom was handy too to spread ourselves out. Our room overlooked the back of the hotel which was a view of the rear of other apartment blocks (residential by the looks of them) and a school yard. This didn't really bother us too much but if you were expecting a view of the Sagrada Familia you might be disappointed by this. (I've included a picture). The staff on reception were all helpful and friendly and all spoke excellent English. The lady in the bar/breakfast area was very sweet and the waiters in the restaurant were pleasant enough. Everything was clean and they were happy to provide a high chair when we ate in the communal areas. We borrowed an iron and ironing board - if you are thinking of doing this don't bother or ask for one that actually works. The one we had was hardly worth the effort for all the difference it made. My main negative point would have to be the general noise - the rooms weren't very sound proof and you could hear the school children playing on their break times, people walking in heels on the floor above, people in neighbouring apartments closing and opening their window shutters (electronic) and their TV's and chatter from people in the corridors. It wasn't dreadful but enough for me to make think to mention it although I wouldn't let it sway your decision. The only reason I have not given the service 5 stars is because half way through our stay they changed the breakfast policy that instead of going down to the bar area as we had been doing for a buffet style breakfast we received a note under the door saying from now on breakfast will be room service only and you must order on the previous day. I preferred the old system as I didn't always know what I would want the next morning and want to order in advance. I'm not sure if this was a one off for any particular reason or if it's a winter season thing maybe? As for location - we were happy with that. You are a stones throw from the Sagrada Familia and there are some little shops and supermarkets nearby for food. There are a couple of tube stations within walking distance and it is possible, if you don't mind a longer stroll, to walk to places like Las Ramblas which I think took us about half hour (maybe slightly more). It depends what you want though as it was a little further away from the action in terms of shopping and nightlife and there didn't seem to be too many restaurants on the doorstep. With a small baby this didn't really bother us too much but it may be a problem for other people who would prefer to be really central and in the thick of it. Overall I would be happy to go back as it was clean, friendly and good value for money in terms of facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Spacious, great value, good location for first stay in Barcelona. Great for groups with more than 2 people!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_j_s
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: Loved this place, exceeded my expectations for the price. Would definitely recommend to everyone! I went to Barcelona with my parents and brother for one night and this hotel was great, especially for a group with more than 2 people. It had a large living room and kitchen, 2 bedrooms that were across the apartment from each other (1 with a queen or king and one with two twin beds) and 2 full bathrooms and free wi-fi! All for only 160 euros. We booked this rate directly through the hotel site. I wish we could have stayed more than one night, but we were on our way to Alcossebre (towards Valencia). Definitely the perfect place for families or two couples looking to stay in a great place for a great price. Pros: - Space! Huge kitchen with washer/dryer, dishwasher, all kitchen amenities you need. 2 full bathrooms made getting ready in the morning a lot easier - 1 had a tub and one had a standing shower. 2 large bedrooms that are separated across the apartment (if you've ever shared a wall with a roomie in an apartment you'll know this is a great and rare thing) Large living room / dining area with full couch and full kitchen table. Balcony was great add on to the space and beautiful spot for morning coffee - Modern with hardwood floors, new bathrooms, etc. - Free wi-fi. - Good Service - the staff helped us get a around and stored our luggage - Balcony with views of Sagrada Familia! (Architectural gem by Gaudi) - Location - not on La Rambla or in gothic quarter, but safe neighbourhood with lots of shops and restaurants, very close to the Metro. A couple of grocery stores within a few blocks - just ask at the desk! Cons: - A little hard to find. We had never been to Barcelona before and the street signs are virtually non-existent or hard to find in some areas. We walked from the Metro and had trouble due to street names changing in mid street and confusing us a bit and the hotel sign wasn't too noticeable. Would recommend calling ahead and getting clear 'turn right turn left' type directions - A couple of small maintenance issues, but minor. Shower head in main bathroom didn't stay up. If we had stayed more than 1 night we would have asked them to fix it, but we just used the other shower. Window in 2nd bathroom was broken. - Beds are pretty firm - didn't bother us, but it might not work out for you. When looking for Barcelona accommodations it was hard to find an affordable option for 4 people. (Most of Europe has rooms for only 2 or occasionally 3 people). We were going to get 2 rooms and hoping to do so for around 100 euros a night, but knew that the place wouldn't be that great at that price. Instead we got to stay at Hispanos 7 suiza for less money and in a beautiful place in a good location. Note: it's not right in the Gothic Quarter or right on La Rambla, but the money you save makes it easy to walk or use the metro to get to these more central areas. We did actually walk into the centre of the city via the shopping on Passeig de Gracia and then over to the gothic area and la rambla and eventually to the water. But we took the Metro back because by then we were all exhausted from the walking. So if you're ok walking a fair bit or taking the Metro the location will work great for you. Tip - get a T10 metro card - it can be used by multiple people and makes using the metro super cheap! A couple of photos coming soon...

Reviews.Title: “Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: ewilliams719
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel from 9/30 -10/2 and it was everything as mentioned in previous posts. The hotel is a perfect size and the front desk staff is helpful and patient. It was the perfect pre-cruise hotel. There were seven of us in total (all adults) and we booked two apartments facing the front of the hotel. Both apartments had two bedroooms, two bathrooms, living room, small kitchen and cute balcony facing the street. The hotel is close to a supermarket and lovely cafes where you can run for coffee, tea and freshly baked bread in the morning. It was truly our "home away from home" and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “My hotel of choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: run312
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona on a 7 day vacation with 3 friends in August 2009, and stayed at this hotel. We had a 4-person suite with a large balcony, 2 separate bedrooms and fully equipped kitchen. All 4 of us were unusually satisfied with it. The service is almost extravagant, the rooms are always clean, and the suites are generally just nice and comfortable. It is spacious and modern, and being there it seems more like a private apartment than a hotel room. Breakfast is somewhat average but fine. The neighborhood is very calm and the thick isolation of the apartments takes care of any eventual noise, making the apartments completely silent during night. Also worthy of mentioning is the good air conditioning with an electronic control panel in the living room, from where the temperature of the suite can be adjusted. It is great value for money in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: citycats
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 3 nights with our 2 adult children. The apartment was clean and spacious.It had excellent air conditioning. We had 2 bedrooms, one with a king size bed and another with 2 twin beds. There were 2 bathrooms. The kitchen had a washer/dryer combo unit ( took approx 3 hours to wash and dry- small capacity). There was also a dishwasher and a large flatscreen TV. The internet worked great. There is access to a gym with a pool about 1 block away but not at the actual hotel site. There was a balcony but the view was the back of apartments with laundry drying. We opted to purchase breakfast which consited of various breads, pastries, cereal, meat sandwhiches, fruit, juices and coffee. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is about 1 block from the metro and Sagrada Familia. We took a train and metro from the airport to the hotel without much difficulty ( there were some long corridors in metro if you are carrying your luggage). You can easily take the metro to other destinations ( such as the Ramblas) within 10-15 minutes. We would definitely reccommend this hotel to others and would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with very helpful receptionists”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTheCurious
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel. We had a great stay, thanks to the fully-equipped kitchen and two comfortable big rooms! It's also very close to the Temple Expiatori de la Sagrada Família, so it really saved us a lot of time to visit there. Last but not least, the receptionists, especially one called Susanna, were very helpful! They were very patient in helping us call the airport staff about our lost luggages. I would strongly recommend this hotel to every one of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite for family stay”
Reviews.Author: kas356
Reviews.Content: Just finished staying here for 4 nights with my family (3 young children). We had a 2-bedroom suite that was clean, well-furnished and very comfortable. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. It is located very close to the Metro (aside from Sagrada Familia you will need to travel around to get everywhere else) and many restaurants. We all were able to get a good night's sleep due to the comfort of the room, the fact that the area isn't that loud, and the retractable black-out shades in the room. It is a bit expensive during peak season, I suppose, but finding a room with comfortable space for 5 is a bit of a challenge in Europe generally. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding especially for a family!”
Reviews.Author: SoonerWiz
Reviews.Content: We traveled here and stayed with our three grown children (23,21,19). The suite was spacious and beautiful and having two bathrooms and a washer/dryer was a huge plus on our journey through Europe. The staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Spectacular views of La Sagrada Familia from our balcony. We loved it being a little off the beaten path, just a short walk from the metro. I highly recommend it, especially to families!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: TexasKami
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable top-floor suite with two bedrooms, a small living room, good kitchen and a pleasant balcony. There was a washer/dryer, which was a great asset. Staff were extremely nice. Location is good for Sagrada Familia but a walk (or metro ride) to everything else, which was fine for us but might be a problem for others. Neighborhood is somewhat residential, so there are supermarkets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quiet stay.”
Reviews.Author: clairegeorge76
Reviews.Content: We had a first floor room on our first night and would agree with comments about noise from the stairwell. We asked to move room and for the remaining stay we had a top floor room with spacious balcony. There were no noise issues once we'd moved. The rooms were clean and spacious. I'd recommend for those happy to stay out of the centre of Barcelona and looking for a bit of quiet. It was a 20 minute walk - longer if strolling - to Las Ramblas or an easy metro journey. There are supermarkets very near by and a number of nice cafes etc, plus a very good ice cream shop on the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but you hear ALL the sounds in the building...”
Reviews.Author: azroxie
Reviews.Content: Like others posted, our taxi driver had to look at his map to find this place too. We stayed here for 1 night, pre-cruise. It was very clean and was perfect for a family of four. Two bedrooms (full bed in one and 2 twins in the other) and 2 bathrooms, a living room, and a small kitchenette. The kitchen really came in handy when we couldn't find any decent open restaurants at 7:30 at night?? We bought a few things at the grocery store around the corner for dinner and breakfast. The beds were comfy and clean. Wood floors. Simple furnishing. Very nice (and I'm very picky about hotels!) The only channel on TV in English was the Disney Channel. (fyi) The tiny elevator couldn't fit the four of us and our 3 suitcases...so we had to take 2 trips arriving and checking-out. Service was very friendly. My ONLY complaint was whoever was staying in the room above us sounded like they were doing Irish Dancing in high-heel shoes all night long, then we heard opera singing...this was in the middle of the night. You HEAR everything!!! We also heard doors slamming all night long too. Not a quiet place. It would had been worse if we weren't so tired and groggy from jet-lag.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Hispanos 7 Suiza”
Reviews.Author: Roger-Eva
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our almost 13 year old son in a two bedroom apartment for four nights in may. The breakfast was ok, very good coffee. Dinner at restaurant was good, maybe a bit expensive. The apartment was very good inside. The problem is more around it. The apartments are build around a staircase, so we could hear doorslamming and all sounds outside the apartment. Maybe that would have been better if we've stayed in an apartment higher up. It took quite some time to get some hot water, except for the first night. As I said, the apartment was great. Very good location, near the Sagrada Familia church, subway-station and busses.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: hobbyistravel
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is such a cool city! It's also expensive, and it can be hard to find hotels with a bit more space if you are traveling with your children. This one was pretty good in that respect. Good things were that it has a cool dining room with old cars in it (and a great breakfast with amazing coffee). The apartments have plenty of space, they have those Euro-style shutters outside the windows so it gets very dark at night, good for sleeping. They have washers. The only negative would be that the apartments are very dark in general and the furnishings are a bit old-fashioned. That's all fine, it's just Barcelona is full of the most amazing modern designs, you sort of wish they had jazzed up the place a little bit, however, it's not a very big deal. We stayed in a couple of apartments (two bedroom to one bedroom because they were fully booked our last night). As someone else noted, taxis don't know where it is, but if you say go to the Sagrada Familia, you can easily walk from there. You can also walk to a decent grocery store. One last thing, the staff were really super-nice here, helping us rent a car, giving us directions to the coast, very responsive on email as we booked the visit. for families, this place is great. If you are a hip young couple (or hip silver surfers), you could find trendier places.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Roberto10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days in this hotel ( my wife and a 11 year kid ) and I can say the hotel is great, mainly if you go with your family or a group. Cabbies generally don't know the hotel, so you have to say that it's near "Sagrada Familia" church. My apartment had one living room (small couch, a central table and a 32" LCD TV), one kitchen (complete), two rooms ( two single beds each ) , one bathroom and one big balcony with a view to the back of the hotel. It was all very clean and new. The only problem with the room is that the walls are too thin and you have to be luck with your neigbours because you can hear everything they say when you are in the living room and your neighbours are in theirs. There's a door between the living room and the bedrooms, so you can shut that door if your neighbours are "too happy". At night it was very quiet from our room ( back view ); The breakfast you have to ask for the only person that works there ( who struggles a lot when many people appear at the same time ). We think there should be another person helping her. There aren't many options for food but it's enough to start your day. There are two metro stations near ( Verdaguer and Sagrada Familia ). The unfinished Sagrada Familia church is two blocks away with a small park in front of it. All the attractions ( but Sagrada Familia ) are far from the hotel, so we had to use the metro a lot. It was not a problem to us because the metro was very clean and fast. We had dinner once in the hotel's restaurant and it's not expensive (around EUR 20) if you choose "Menu del dia", which is a three course meal with wine as an option. Inside the restaurant there are two old cars what makes the enviroment very pleasant. If I ever go back to Barcelona ( I hope I will ) I definately would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveCindy
Reviews.Content: The staff here couldn't be nicer and if you love old vintage cars when you dine then this is the place for you! Combines the benefits of an apartment with that of a hotel and the rooms are great size etc. Location is beside the unfinished Gaudi Church and the location is a little off the beaten track however there is a metro 5 minutes away so no problem getting around. Great value for money and staff were cool - they lent me an umbrella when it rained! well recommended if the location suits you

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: chelmsleygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hispanos with three friends for 4 nights. This is the second time we have stayed here and we could not fault it. There is no way we could get two double hotel rooms for less than we paid here. When you add the fact that we had a lounge to chat in a kitchen to make a drink and two bathrooms plus breakfast, all in a lovelly setting you just cant go wrong. I could say that two years ago the breakfast was better than now but what we got was still more than enough. For us the location was fine once we sussed out the transport and it is so much easier to sleep here than in the city. The staff were all polite and helpful when we needed them. What more can you ask for. I would recommend this apartment as being suitable for anyone

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Spacious and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Room_101_London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hispano Suiza with our two children. It was a great treat to have an apartment where we could spread out, make our own food when we wanted to, wash our clothes in the washing machine and even relax on the large balcony. The rooms were excellent - a master bedroom, good quality put me ups in the "lounge" and a pretty well equipped kitchen. We felt that we were staying in luxury well beyond what we can normally afford. The staff were extremely helpful, helping us to enjoy being in the city, especially little things that turned out to be big things like advising us to go the amazing Gracia fiesta where sreet aftter street is decorated with community artwork and bands play all night for free. The kids loved the super size whirlpool bath and appreciated the amazing collection of rare HIspano Suiza cars in the breakfast room. We also all appreciated the generous buffet breakfast which set us up nicely each day. The location by the Sagrada Familia was fine for us as there are easy bus connections from there to everywhere else in the city. It was also a boon to us to be able to use the hotel's parking garage, which through it cost a bit was very convenient and safe for our car packed with five week's holiday gear!

Reviews.Title: “This apartment-hotel is convenient and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: TexasT0urist
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is an expensive city to visit. It can be difficult to find a hotel that is modern, clean, centrally located, and still allows you to maintain a vacation budget. This hotel addresses these concerns. Yes, this hotel is not inexpensive, but compared to other hotels in Barcelona, this hotel is a good value. We are a middle aged couple (50's) who was accompanied by an elderly parent (96). We speak Castellano, however the hotel staff does speak English so communications was not a problem. Our suite was on the 5th floor, in the back of the building. Evenings and nights were very quiet.; so any concerns you may have about getting a good night's sleep in a densely populated city were not a problem. In addition to a kitchen table, the balcony has a table for outdoor dining, so we ate all our evening meals there relaxing and enjoying the beautiful sunset. The kitchette is equiped with mini-refridgerator, dishwasher, flatware, dishes, venthood and stovetop. We cleaned the kitchen after our meals so as to avoid the costly cleaning fees. There are two neighborhood supermarkets (Consum and Carrefour) around the corners from the hotel with reasonable prices on local produce so you can either prepare your own meals from scratch or buy cheeses, sausages, a variety of cured hams, freshly baked bread, and local wines, as we did, for late night dining. Although the hotel is three blocks from the Sagrada Familia, were there are many tourists, the street was safe. Getting a taxis outside the hotel to visit most tourist sites was easy, costing about 5 to 7 Euros. The neighborhood is inhabited by a mixture of mainly elderly and professional couples, so there are some restaurants and cafes, however you'll most likely find more restaurants in the areas of town frequented by tourists. This was not a problem since we were sightseeing in areas of the city were we could find a reasonably priced menu del dia. Between 7:30 and 11:00 an extensive buffet breakfast is provided offering eggs, yoguts, fresh fruits, cereals, pasteries, sausages, sobrasatta, fresh bread, coffee, milk, fruit juices, cheese, and ham. This is very helpful since trying to find a modestly priced restaurant in the morning in Barcelona is a challenge. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better impossible”
Reviews.Author: welsch7
Reviews.Content: I´ve been there 3 times and every stay is much better than last one: Staff, breakfast, rooms, service, restaurant, location...better impossible!! I´ll recomend this hotel to every single person

Reviews.Title: “OK quality, great terrace, but a problem also”
Reviews.Author: Lomamatka
Reviews.Content: As has been said in many of the reviews, the hotel is of good basic quality with enough space for 4-5 people in the apartment. We enjoyed especially the big terrace we had facing the inner yard (on the 5th floor) which meant that it was also silent in the mornings. The rooms are quite clean, although sofas etc. do need some updating soon enough. Also, the beds are quite hard, but that's always a very personal issue - some like them hard. The restaurant was very good, I suggest trying it for the 20e price you get by being a hotel stayer. As such I feel that the location of the hotel is somewhat far, but metro works extremely well so everything is within reach. For someone visiting the city for the first time, I suggest going more towards the city center. But all in all, the price-quality-ratio was reasonable for us (2 adults, 2 kids). However, and unfortunately, our stay was dominated by a major problem: 2-4 times a day (and we basically just stayed in during late evenings and nights) the apartment was filled with the most terrible smell. This "sewer smell" brought through airconditioning lasted 10-15 minutes each time, but was strong enough to wake us at night. When mentioning about the problem we were offered a change of rooms, which we decided not to do, just out of sheer laziness and general pessimism (changing one problem often turns into just another problem i.e. a more noicy apartment). I do hope that the hotel has resolved the problem, but I cannot bring myself to believe that this was a total surprise for them...Thus, not a big hurray from us.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: cyrydwr
Reviews.Content: If you have trouble finding a hotel catering for a family of 2 adults and 3 children in a good Barcelona location, then you could do much worse than trying out the Hispanos siete. The apartment we had for a 3 night stay included 2 bedrooms/2 bathrooms and a spacious living area comnsisting of a sitting area and a clean, well equipped (with dishwasher + washing machine) kitchen area. The standard of the furnishing was excellent and everything was in good working order (including aircon). We requested an extra bed because of our non-standard group of 5 - which came at a supplement of 30 euros per night. The Sagrada Familia is just around the corner, although you'll find youself using a lot of the metro if you want to see the sights of Montjuic, the Harbour and the Barri Gothic. The striking restaurant area houses some classic Hispano-Suiza cars - which kept the attention of the kids at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartments”
Reviews.Author: JamieW44
Reviews.Content: Large, well furnished and spotless apartments. A good value for several people or a small family. We had a two bedroom apartment for four adults and really enjoyed our five night stay. We even used the kitchen for a quick lunch or dinner most days. (There are two excellent super markets within a block and a half). The location is fair, one block from Sagrada Familia Cathedral but has great access to the subway system which is an excellent way to travel around Barcelona. The breakfast provided with the room was good. We would use this Hotel again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful apartment hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rejsemor
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, two blocks from the Sagrada Familia. The amenities in the hotel included a full kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine (the terrace included a clothes line), so if you were staying a week or longer you could easily cook your own meals. There were two bedrooms with their own bathrooms, a living room, and a wonderful terrace with a small table and two chairs overlooking the street below. The breakfast buffet was decent and the restaurant was nice and airy. They served dinner every night with a pris fixe menu though we didn't get a chance to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Family Travel”
Reviews.Author: annecbb
Reviews.Content: Three generations stayed 5 nights at Hispanos 7 Suiza and everyone found things to love. The spacious two bedroom, two bath apartments with full kitchen AND washer/drier, plus porch, gave us plenty of room to roam and all the amenities we needed. The location is great, very close to the Metro which is clean, very easy to use, inexpensive, and fast. We never waited more than 2.5 minutes for a train (I wish we could say that at home in DC!) and with the hotel close to two different lines, it was easy to arrange a route to most place we wanted to visit. Staff was generally friendly and all were accomodating of our needs. There are TWO playgrounds, each about a block away. One is in the plaza next to the Sagrada Familia Cathedral, so the adults can sit and admire the architecture while the young ones run around. There are some things worth knowing. The area immediately around the Cathedral is very touristy. This has some advantages (restaurants are open even on Sunday night and serve at odd hours) but the pizza joints and t-shirt vendors get old quickly. However, this is only the area *immediately* around the Cathedral. Turn the corner and you have your own "authentic" Barcelona neighborhood, with your own neighborhood corner grocery, fruit & veggie stand, cafe, etc. While there are two complete baths, only the bedroom with the twin beds has a bath accessible from within the room. The room with the double bed has a bathroom about two steps from the bedroom door. If you are traveling with people who have a high need for privacy, this layout may be an issue. Also, the twin bed bath only has a shower, no tub. The hotel restaurant offers a very reasonably priced "menu" -- 3 courses for E20 -- the food and dining room are both pleasant. However, they only serve dinner at 9 pm. If you shift to "Barcelona time" that works great, but if you are used to an earlier dinner, that can be a limitation. Service is a bit formal. Think of it as an easy resource for a pleasant night out, not a family dinner. Breakfast was a buffet including fresh fruit, various kinds of bread, cheese, and sliced meats, hard boiled eggs, a sweet tart, plus cereal and juice. Lots of choice, but don't expect a "full English breakfast." Rooms on the front of the hotel may have a view of the Cathedral (we were on the 3rd floor and one of the two balconies had a view) BUT also get a lot of street noise. The recycling containers for the neighborhood are right across the street and the early morning pick up of the bottles was quite a racket. The rooms on the interior of the hotel get a view of Barcelona life, with a view of many apartment patios and balconies, plus the sounds of children on a school playground. All in all, I preferred the interior apartment for sound control, since I was only 1/2 block from the Cathedral plaza with a spectacular view, but it will make a difference. The hotel shows signs of a high quality hotel which is in need of a bit of a spruce up -- the TV was small (not an issue for us, since we never turn it on), there were a few stains on the sofa, sometimes internet reception was slow, that sort of thing. But overall the quality was very high. We would absolutely return again and recommend it to others, especially those traveling in a group or with children.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: C&BPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our 8 day stay at Hispanos 7 in March, 2009. Having a real kitchen was a delight. We shopped at THE Market and enjoyed fresh meals several evenings. The washer/dryer meant we needed to pack less - a treat! The location is extremely convenient to the Metro and we easily travelled the city at all times of the day and night. Barcelona is a fabulous city to visit. Go! You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Apartments Offer Home Away From Home..”
Reviews.Author: OwenyOg
Reviews.Content: We had four nights here with our two young children and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is one block from Gaudi's Cathedral - and about 8 blocks from the Passaig Gracia and the Ramblas. We enjoyed the walk. Apartments are compact but have everything we needed for a family of four. Staff were great. The breakfast was OK - kept us going until lunchtime. The restaurant looked fantastic but a little pricey when travelling with two youngsters so we didn't pay it a visit - maybe next time... Recommend this to anyone who needs a little more than a standard Hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nattie224
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, comfortable, spacious, friendly reception staff and just round the Corner from the Sagrada Familia. Our suite had 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms between the two of us which was fantastic. Contintental style breakfast included in the price with chocolate croissants and doughnuts! Hotel guests get 30% off dinner in the restaurant except on Saturdays - the food is fantastic but expensive. They have a pianist playing while you eat. Inside tip: if you don't order a starter they bring you one for free anyway, also if you don't order dessert they bring you a little plate of cakes for free! As much bread as you want is free with the meal (we didn't like to ask as it was so posh but were relieved when the bill came!) The only downsides were - there isn't a huge choice of restaurants in this area of the city, although we did find places to eat nearby and the Metro station is only a couple of blocks away to get to the city centre. If you have a room at the back it just looks out onto other highrise buildings and people's gardens but for a city hotel it wasn't bad. There is a school in the square at the back of the hotel, which, if you stay in your room during the day Monday-Friday, you'll hear the children out playing as it echos around the square, but we were far too busy sightseeing to worry about this! We didn't really use the kitchen but you need to take dishwasher tablets/washing powder with you if you want to use the appliances as these aren't provided/you have to pay quite a lot for them. The rooms have wooden floors so if the people above you scrape furniture along the floor you can hear it (the people above us seemed to do this a lot but it wasn't a huge nuisance). I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DB41
Reviews.Content: Four of us - 2 adult couples - stayed at the Hispanos 7 Suiza (H7S) for 8 nights 12/28/08 - 1/6/09. The hotel is about 10 blocks from the center of Barcelona, but a subway is easily available. (Ten rides cost less than 8 Euros and rides can be shared.) The hotel is 5 floor high and consists of 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartments. There is a front desk that's staffed 24/7. A free breakfast (cold cereals, yougurt, fresh fruit, pastries and breads, juice, and beverages) is provided in the upscale restaurant on street level. The apartment is about 400 sq. feet. There's A long living room with a separate kitchen area at one end. The appliances are modern (d/w, built in oven, 2 burner range top, undercounter refrig,. with small freezer, microwave, toaster, and washer/dryer). The furniture is basic - upholstered coach and easy chair, small TV, glass top dining room table for 4. The living room - kitchen is about 11ft wide x 20 ft long. There are 2 small bedrooms, about 10 ft x 10ft. (Each has its own closet with hanging space, shelving, and drawers.) One has a queen bed, the other has twin beds. (The twins can be pushed together.) There's a hall bathroom (small tub with hand-held that doesn't mount on a wall) bidet, toilet, sink and lots of mirrors. We assigned that bath to one couple. The other bath is attached to the twin-bedded room. It has a small shower, toilet, and sink. It's tight, but it's certainly functional. The apartment has it's own heating and a/c system. It worked well. There's also a front balcony - probably 11 ft x 3.5 ft. There were a couple of problems. Thin doors and walls make privacy within the apartment an issue. One can also hear conversations in the adjoining unit - but this wasn't as serious as it may sound. There are supermarkets around the corner and places with prepared foods within a block or two. We didn't prepare meals but it was convenient to have cooked food and drinks available. The place was small for 4, but it suited our purposes. The modern bathrooms and kitchen were far from depressing. The rate was 230 euros a day plus a 7% tax. That's reasonable for 2 couples. We were there during an expensive time period. My guess is that discounts are readily available at other times of the year.. We found H7S a good alternative to a 4 star hotel. And during this holiday season, two rooms at a 4 star hotel would have cost significantly more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CCCLady
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for the Royal Suite (for 8 adults) at the Hispanos Siete Suiza located on Sicilia (255) Street between Provenca and Rossello. The hotel was only 2 blocks from the Sagrada Familia. It was a very easy walk. When we arrived at the hotel, the royal suite was not ready yet. The desk clerk offered us 2 junior suites (each with 2 bedrooms) for the same price as the Royal Suite (€460). This worked out better so everyone had a bed instead of 2 of us on rollaways in the living room of the Royal Suite. One of the rooms was ready at that time. The room was very nice. One of the bedrooms contained 2 twin beds with a bathroom with a multi headed shower. The second bedroom was a king size bed with the bathroom with a tub in the hall. There was a safe in the closet. The electric did not work in the room until we placed one of the room keys in the slot by the door. The balcony overlooked a school yard. The windows had electronic shutters to completely cover the windows. The breakfast buffet was wonderful at the hotel. Since we were a group of 8, they had a table ready for all of us but 4 of the group slept in. After we ate, we went to the Sagrada Familia at 9AM (€10). We were on the second elevator to the top. It was worth the €2.50 to go to the top for some amazing views. We decided to walk down the 426 steps instead of taking the elevator. We checked out of our hotel and walked back to the Sagrada Familia for a cab to the pier. The cab was €20 for 4 people with 4 pieces of luggage. We were on the ship by 12:30PM. If you order a cab at the hotel, it will cost €35 Euros to go from the hotel to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CJC30
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in Oct. '08 . Friendly & helpful staff, great rooms ( in need maybe of a little modernisation) . Breakfast buffet was included in room rate & was an additional benefit, never too busy & whilst variety was limited the quality of the food was good. Overall a very good stay , can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Accommodations and the Best Service Staff”
Reviews.Author: MEAQ
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member, Ohio, USA We stayed at Hispanos 7 Suiza while in Barcelona before our Mediterranean cruise. We were a 3 generation family travelling and it was difficult finding lodging in Europe for 5 people (my elderly mother, my husband and I with a teenager and a younger child). I chanced upon this wonderful hotel which offers very spacious 2 and 3 bedroom apartments with the same amount of bathrooms. It had a balcony in our living room and a fully equipped kitchen. The decor was classic with modern touches. The hotel is so clean and the breakfast that is included is excellent. The hotel staff arranged for our airport pick-up, tour of the city , restaurant meals and port transfer. The staff is so helpful and it felt like home away from home. It was a great experience and I would definitely stay at this hotel again when in Barcelona. It's around the corner from Sagrada Familia, Barcelona's most famous landmark by Gaudi.

Reviews.Title: “best apartments”
Reviews.Author: maur0
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel online and twice i got cut off while providing card details , eventually rung the hotel directly and sorted out my booking with night porter who gave me the same web special rate. When we arrived [ 1.00 pm ] in the afternoon our [ huge ] apartment was ready . I have never stayed in an accommodation as big and as comfortable as this. Two large bedrooms two bathrooms kitchen and sitting room just for myself and my wife.Really enjoyed the [ champagne ] breakfast the following day also , all in all e very good stay, will definitely stay here again. Mr Mauro Pettinelli

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sierralala
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful and the price was great! We were a group of 8 adults that were in Barcelona for 2 nights. The total for our stay was 800 Euros, which when broken up over 8 people, was very inexpensive compared to the other hotels in this town. We rented the Royal Suite, which has three bedrooms. The hotel added two roll away beds for the extra people. The rooms were very spacious, simple and classy. It had a nice kitchen, sitting area, and dining area. The huge balcony was great! We spent a lot of our time out there, at the table, chatting and drinking wine, eating cheese and bread (which we purchased at the grocery store right around the corner). The neighborhood is fantastic, although close to the Sagrada Familia, it is not in a turisty area. There are plenty of little bars/tapas places around and a taxi ride to the normal attractions takes about 10 minutes. The hotel has a restaurant, and although it got great reviews we didn't eat there, except for the breakfast that was included in the price. However, we did make use of the bar, and had a great time there. The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. We would definitely go back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: blackthomas333
Reviews.Content: Located just by the Sagrada Familia (though you won't see it from most apartments), this hotel is a short metro ride from Passeig de Gracia/the Ramblas.
