The apartments are relatively spacious (for a smallish couple with smallish kids) and comfortably furnished (neither at the cutting edge of design nor chintzy) with airco, full kitchen (fridge, hob, washing machine, dishwasher, etc.), living room, terrace, two bedrooms (one with twin beds, the other with a double) and two bathrooms (one with shower, one with bath, both with toilet), which speeds things up no end when preparing to go out. The beds are comfortably firm. The breakfast buffet offered a fair amount of choice: croissants, fresh fruit, cold meats, cheese, bacon and scrambled eggs, doughnuts, tarts (even cava for those who can face it at breakfast). The breakfast room is large and the tables offered lots of elbow room. The reception staff were unfailingly charming and helpful. The hotel restaurant was closed for August but looked like it might actually be quite good. We were very happy with our choice and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredfred1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this apartment hotel with my family of 5 . The apartments are kept very clean and have nice modern facilities. It is close to the train station and we loved walking past Sagrada Familie every day. The staff are helpful . We were also impressed that all the funds raised by the hotel go to a cancer foundation set up by a doctor after his wife passed away from cancer. He has also since passed and now his old car collection is housed in the lobby and the restaurant along with his old medical books.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: 007zac
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two nights. But it is was a welcome break after travelling by ferry and train for three days.Very friendly and helpful staff who went the extra mile. The rooms were spacious and clean, it was very handy to have a washing machine. We found the apartment to be very quiet on a night for some much needed sleep. Our two children loved old cars and the breakfasts were fab.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodations in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: Hispanos 7 Suiza is a great place for families in Barcelona. Our groups of four stayed for three nights -- myself, my husband and our 13 and 10 year old daughters. There was plenty of room for us and we never felt crowded. The kitchenette was helpful, as we ate a couple of meals in to save a little money. Breakfasts, included in the price, were very good. I found the hotel to be clean throughout and the front office staff was extremely helpful at all times. We loved staying in the quieter Eixample area of Barcelona, as it gave us a break from the crowds at the end of the day. I would highly recommend this hotel to any family looking for accommodations in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Hispanos Heaven”
Reviews.Author: macmason
Reviews.Content: WE have jut spent 10 very comfortable days/nights in this apartment i will never stay in a convential barcelona hotel again as long as Hispanos is open. the staff first class ,Breakfast excellent ,Beds wonderful.Free to make great meals using fresh foods from the local markets.in particular fresh fish.eating out in restaurants is expensive and not of the best quality wonderful stay real value, thank youj

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Hispanos 7 Suiza”
Reviews.Author: joduhl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of TripAdvisor reviews and so want to pass on the favor. For us, it was perfect - not fancy, but very clean and welcoming and a very good size apartment (we were 2 adults and 1 teenager). The location was great - a real neighborhood, which I think made our Barcelona experience much better than staying downtown or in a tourist district. We did a lot of people watching, which was fun. We also enjoyed being so close to La Sagrada Familia - we never took the tour, because the lines were so long, but we got to see it regularly from all angles. The hotel is very close to a metro stop which includes 2 subway lines, and the metros in Barcelona run amazingly frequently - we literally never had to wait more than 3 minutes. The staff at the hotel were great - very friendly. We stayed 4 nights, then left for a couple of days and returned for our final night. They let us leave some of our luggage behind (with no charge). When we returned to the hotel it was like coming back home to a familiar and welcoming place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Apollo14
Reviews.Content: For some reason recent reviews have caused this aparthotel to fall down the list. I can't see why. I travelled with my parents, reasonably fussy seventy-somethings and they were more than happy. The rooms are spotless, housekeeping is efficient, the public spaces are unique and interesting. Breakfast (included) in the main room was peaceful, with large tables, plenty of space and a large selection of mostly cold foods. The clientele was mostly families as the layout of the rooms dictates this - a double bed, and two singles in the smallish second room, therefore not really suited to friends sharing. Reception was always polite and helpful with restaurant bookings. The only possible downside to this accommodation is the location - it is not in the epicentre of the city. If you are coming to Barcelona for a short weekend you may want to be closer to the action (i.e. restaurants and cafes). If staying for longer it is an advantage to be in an area that is more peaceful on the street, and with the opportunity to see the Sagrada Familia (1 minute away) lit up each night. That said, travel options are plentiful with a couple of metro lines nearby (3 mins) and buses leaving from beside the SF that will take you into town and the Port Vell area (number 19) or to Montjuic (number 50). Numbers 43 and 44 will take you to Paseig de Gracia. You can be in the centre of things in 15 mins. In summary absolutely no complaints, and highly recommended for families or long, long weekends.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Family Choice”
Reviews.Author: 5fortravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed with our family of 5 and was happy with the accomodations. Although not posh, it more than met our needs. The location adjacent to the Sagrada Familia and proximity to the subway made it an ideal choice for us. Made it easy to beat the crowds to the Sagrada Familia. Never did get the internet to work though. A nice break from typical hotels for our family. Breakfast was included which was a nice feature. Not a bargain though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: KarenE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Barcelona and the Hispanos 7 Suiza. From other reviews we thought it would be a quite elegant and posh accommodation but it was not. The hallways for example have dirty looking walls like in a 2 star hotel. The apartment itself was nicely decorated though. We had the so called Royal Suite at the top floor so we did not hear much noise from other people. The view from the large balcony is not nice though. Many rundown apartment buildings. The bar area of the hotel was always deserted. It is a long and narrow room which overall has no nice and comfortable feel to it. The breakfast room has a very high ceiling and is bright but has no outside windows. Although non smoking smoke came in from an adjacent room. The breakfast selection was quite good for Spanish standards. The thing we really did not like about the Hispanos was the area the hotel is in. The Hispanos is situated on the edge of the Eixample district. Although the Eixample is a very nice upscale area close to the Sagrada Familia it gets more and more boring, nothing upscale any more. Many ugly newer apartment buildings line the streets, only very few of those nice modernist buildings the Eixample is famous for. Next time I wood definately stay closer to Passeig Gracia. It was nice to see the Sagrada at night when returning to the hotel though. Staff at the Hispanos 7 Suiza were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK for small children”
Reviews.Author: ajlcdl
Reviews.Content: This apartment/hotel is in a great area, close to subway and familia sagrada. The actual apt was decent with good cable tv, and spotty internet by DSL (once I got the cable from the front desk and re-configured the computer). The shower in the kids room was great - much better than most Euro hotels. The bad part of all this was the noise from children - the walls are thin, and there are lots of families with kids. Breakfast was decent but in a beautiful room. There was extra charges for lattes from the machine. There was also a smoking room which was too close to the dining area. I wouldn't stay there again unless I had small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great family apartment”
Reviews.Author: passionfortravel2
Reviews.Content: I have read about this apts from trip advisor. And with no surprise, all that has been said is true. An excellent choice for family with children as the apt has 2 bed rooms, 2 bath rooms. Great breakfat buffet. Just want to point out some things tho they are not big deals for us: -we heard some noises from the upstair apt. -eventhough the location is great, there are no good restaurants around except the one from the hotel. So when you're travelling with a baby, it's not easy to take a metro at night just to find nicer restaurants in the center. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A family gem”
Reviews.Author: Latvia_expatAmerican
Reviews.Content: As many have said, the location so close to the Sagrada Familia, the Hop On Hop Off bus and public transportation was ideal for our family of four. When we arrived by Metro from the airport it was a straight shot in a taxi to the hotel and cost us 11 euros. We took our chances and walked in without a reservation - not that I'd recommend this during tourist season! - we got a rate that was 100 euros less than the advertised price! I had a printout of a price through one of the last minute dot com sites (printed out the night before in an airport hotel) and showed this to the front desk, so they honored the price and took an addtional 20 euros off. The added tax/service charge that we weren't aware of until checkout did raise the total though. Do not stay in room #101. The double rooms and double bathrooms were wonderful, kitchenette and sitting area were great but the NOISE was awful! Hence the great price? We had the 'thump,thump' of the bass from the music down below in the restaurant and children above us practicing what sounded like tap dancing till LATE into the evening. My kids were exhausted from two nights of no sleep (there is a reason I travel with ear plugs). The kitchenette came equiped but without soap and they don't do the dishes for you. It's the first place we've stayed where there was a washing machine for your clothes in the kitchen. The breakfast spread was GREAT, which even included self-serve wine... we wondered about that, and the kids had plenty to choose from. The staff were terrific, helpful in making suggestions, calling taxis, restaurants, etc. without hesitation. If you can afford it, or get a deal like we did, I'd highly recommend it, we'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for 7 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Donna47
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children (ages 19 & 20) stayed at the Hispanos Suizas over the Christmas holidays and picked the hotel largely based on the fact that it had two bedrooms and two bathrooms which was less expensive than getting two rooms at most other hotels. We also enjoyed having a sitting area to relax after a long day of sight seeing. We didn't use the kitchen except to keep a few snacks and bottles of wine. I did like having a washer/dryer, although it was a bit musty so we only washed blue jeans - nothing delicate. I also had a hard time figuring out how to work the machine but that may have just been me. One thing that surprised me was that the hotel charged for everything in the kitchen (from tea towels to dishwasher detergent). I bought some laundry soap at the supermarket and didn't use anything other than wine glasses. This may be typical in Europe (in Canada a kitchen would be fully equipped for no extra charge) so I won't portray it as a negative, just something to note. Having breakfast included was a bonus, with a selection of scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, cheeses, breads etc. After a few days it was a bit repetitive, as it always is in these circumstances, but there are alot of options at nearby cafes if you wanted a bit of variety. The waiter in the restaurant was very pleasant. Probably the biggest negative was that our room (number 102) was very noisy, largely due to a crying baby who must have been staying directly above us. The rooms were cleaned every day to a reasonable standard. The front desk staff was very helpful and professional. We only used public transport once, to go to a football game at Camp Nou and otherwise walked everywhere, including Parc Guell, Barcelonetta, the Port etc. We enjoyed this as it justified all the eating and drinking but may be a bit much for young children or the less able. The smoking in Barcelona is hard to take if you're a non smoker so it was nice that the hotel had a no smoking policy in the rooms which it seemed to adhere to. All in all, the Hispanos Suizas met our expectations and I would happily recommend it, particularly for families.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast and a balcony too!”
Reviews.Author: Dna1212
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom suite. Both had their own bathroom - good for my mother and me. My husband enjoyed the balcony and the view from the 5th floor. The suite was spotless and spacious. Service was warm and helpful. The breakfast was vast and was available till 11.00am, great for the late risers (us). We took a taxi from the airport for roughly 30 Euro. The area felt very safe, we had decided not to stay close to La Rambla. The metro was 2 blocks away, right beside the Sagrada Familia church which blew us away every time we passed by. I loved it. Three of us were able to come back from a long day of sightseeing, eating and shopping and lounge comfortably. We paid about 230 Euros / night for the 2 bedrooms which would have slept 4. Whole hearted recommendation here.

Reviews.Title: “Great family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: familyontour
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Barcelona. We stayed here on the strength of the tripadvisor reviews and are happy to add our own positive review as the place was wonderful. The suite we had was nicely furnished with a double room and twin room, 2 bathrooms and a nice sitting area as well as a kitchenette and balcony. It was also really comfortable and quiet. The staff were friendly and the breakfast was spot on. The real advantage was the location - just round the corner from the Sagrada Familia and metro stop. We got a taxi to and from the airport (around 25 euros each way). As others have mentioned, there is a little Polish convenience store almost directly across the road from the hotel (open on Sundays) and you can stock up on water, snacks etc there. While we were there, we enjoyed the bus tour (which goes out past the Sagrada Familia). We also had two lovely meals, one in Bella Napoli which is off Ave Para-lel and the other in Aqua, on the new seafront, as well as a just-ok meal in the Pizza Express (not called that but the logo's the same) at the Sagrada Familia.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the high expections!”
Reviews.Author: 1010RegularTraveller
Reviews.Content: This place is as wonderful as described by fellow Tripadvisors! It contains everything one needs for a self-catering holiday. Plenty of supermarkets around. Reception was great with recommendations. Internet service was free, and as we had our own laptop, they just provided us with the cords. And being so close to the Sagrada Familia means that we avoided the peak hours. I loved and place and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jojokk97
Reviews.Content: I always go by the reviews on Trip Advisor; 9/10 cases they are spot on!! Again, Hispanos 7 Suiza is no exception. Booked 3 nights at this apartment hotel after reading the rave reviews here. And I was overjoyed when I arrived with my parents, tired and worn out after a long delay with flights and taxi journey, to find that the front of the hotel is really nice with big lights and full glass walls, which made us feel very safe (plus it's a lot easier to find home in the dark after too much sangria!). Friendly and helpful staff, esp. the 2 staff on our departure date. Offered to book us a taxi and kept our luggages (as we weren't leaving until the evening and check-out time is noon) without any prob. Apartment itself is massive. Lovely balcony, good-sized kitchen with everything - washing machine, dishwasher, fridge etc, living/dining room, 2 bedrooms (1 en-suite) plus a large bathroom. Massage shower in en-suite bathroom and a large bathtub in the other. So nice to sit outside in the balcony after a long day. Our rates inc breakfasts. Again, fantastic. Lots to choose (hot and cold meat, eggs, bacon, bread....). We dined at the cafeteria area which is downstairs of their top restaurant, with vintage cars everywhere. Felt very posh! Location is unbeatable. Literally 100 yards from Sagrada Familia, L5 and L2 metro lines and the Bus Turistic stop. Lots of restaurants around. Area is residential and felt very safe, although there were 3 of us! Will definitely stay here again whenever I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but.....”
Reviews.Author: YoungIrishman
Reviews.Content: We are a young married couple and we had our 6 month old son with us and my parents joined us for a week. The hotel is in a very nice and safe area. The Sagrada Familia church is literally across the road and there are a huge variety of good relatively inexpensive restaurants nearby. It is a 30 minute walk into the main square in Barcelona. The bedrooms were lovely and it was great to have 2 bathrooms. The dining room/sitting room was quite small but was nicely decorated. The kitchen smelt of dampness and this wasn't the nicest place to relax in as a result. The staff could not have been nicer and helped us when we couldn't get our computer to work on the freely available internet access in each room. It was quite expensive (220 euro per night) but then again most accomodation of a good standard is in Barcelona. Would I stay here again? Probably not. There are hotels in the Barcelona suburbs that are better and a lot less expensive. It's a nice hotel but I certainly wouldn't consider it plush.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel -- perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: Bay_Area_flyer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Barcelona, where we split our time between the Hispanos 7 Suiza and the Hotel Arts. We loved the H7S and highly recommend it. First, the space was invaluable. 2 BRs, kitchen, 2 baths... more than plenty of room to spread out. It compared well to a timeshare or residence club (without the pool). As a family of 4 (2 young kids) it was nice to have a clothes washer in the unit as well. The on-site restaurant was nice. Breakfast was included in our rate, and while not amazing it was a great way to start the day. We ate dinner at La Cupula one evening and loved it -- very high-quality food. We enjoyed the location. The kids loved seeing La Sagrada Familia every day as we headed to the Metro station. We also enjoyed being in a residential neighborhood. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Most of the other guests seemed to be visiting from other parts of Spain, and they were friendly as well. When we return to Barcelona, we will most definitely return to the H7S!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: jMeredithg
Reviews.Content: This aparthotel was fabulous. Located just a block from Sagrada Familia and the metro, it was a great home base. Walking to the metro alone at night is not recommended, but if you are with another person or in a group it is fine. There is a grocery store around the corner -- the area dining isn't great, but for a quick coffee it worked well. The staff was very helpful and spoke great english. Our room included 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a living room area, kitchen (with dishwasher, washing machine, stove), and back patio (overlooking the backs of apartment buildings; one included a naked man sunbathing). If you are looking for a good place to settle in for a while this is a comfortable place that is very clean. Definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: yn10
Reviews.Content: It's a great deal for the price. We had a 2 bedroom, 2 baths apartment, with a small kitchen, and a washer-dryer machine (it was a bit loud, so I wouldn't run it at night). The location is great: 2 min. from the Segrada Familia, metro station, some small restaurants and bars, and even a grocery store. The staff at the hotel were nice and helpful. A wonderful place for a family. One thing to keep in mind-- it is a little bit away from the old city and other attractions, but it only takes 3 metro stops to get there, and with metro being just around the corner, this wasn't an issue at all. Overall - we would stay there again with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SAM_smitian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and loved it. There is even a washing machine in the room
